name: Arrowhead Pharmaceuticals
core_thesis: Arrowhead's TRiM platform enables extra-hepatic RNAi delivery, differentiating from Alnylam's liver-focused approach. Near-term catalysts in obesity (ARO-INHBE) and approved Plozasiran provide multiple shots on goal.
one_liner: RNAi platform company with extra-hepatic (lung, muscle, adipose) delivery capability via TRiM technology

bull_case: TRiM platform enables delivery to lung, muscle, and adipose tissue â€” not just liver
ARO-INHBE targets INHBE gene, a validated obesity pathway; Phase 1 data showed meaningful weight loss
Plozasiran best-in-class triglyceride reduction; near approval
Pulmonary expansion with ARO-MUC5AC for COPD/asthma - significant technical achievement
Deep pipeline provides multiple chances for success
bear_case: Alnylam dominates RNAi space with established commercial infrastructure
ARO-INHBE obesity data still early; unclear if competitive with GLP-1s
Cash burn remains elevated with multiple Phase 3 trials
Execution risk on extra-hepatic delivery claims

assets.name: Plozasiran
assets.one_liner: Best-in-class triglyceride reduction for severe hypertriglyceridemia

assets.name: ARO-INHBE
assets.one_liner: Novel RNAi approach to obesity targeting INHBE gene

assets.name: Zodasiran (ARO-ANG3)
assets.one_liner: Phase 3 cardiovascular program partnered with Amgen

assets.name: ARO-APOC3
assets.one_liner: Second-gen APOC3 siRNA with Amgen partnership

assets.name: ARO-MUC5AC
assets.one_liner: Pulmonary delivery - first extra-hepatic RNAi program

assets.name: ARO-DUX4
assets.one_liner: Muscle delivery for facioscapulohumeral muscular dystrophy
